br.octahedron.cotopaxi.cloudservice
Interface TaskManagerFacade

public interface TaskManagerFacade

Class responsible by execute tasks. Tasks can be added to a specific queue. Queues are like pools, that can't have different rate and/or policies for task scheduling. For more details, you should look at the TaskManager implementation being used.

Author:
Danilo Penna Queiroz - daniloqueiroz@octahedron.com.br

Method Detail

add

void add(Task task,
         long delayMillis)
Adds a Task to be executed after the given delay. The task will be add to the default queue and will be added only if the queue doesn't contains a task with the same name. After added to the queue, task can't be changed, and modifying the params Map will has no effects.

Parameters:
task - The task to be added.
delayMillis - The delay, in milliseconds, to execute the task.

add

void add(Task task,
         long delayMillis,
         String queueName)
Adds a Task to be executed after the given delay. It'll try to add the task to the queue with the given name, or will add to the default queue if the given queue doesn't exists. After added to the queue, task can't be changed, and modifying the params Map will has no effects.

Parameters:
task - The task to be added.
delayMillis - The delay, in milliseconds, to execute the task.
queueName - The queue's name.

createQueue

void createQueue(String queueName)
                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
Creates a new queue with the given name (Optional Operation).

Parameters:
queueName - The queue's name
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - If the operation is not supported.

createQueue

void createQueue(String queueName,
                 Map<String,String> queueProperties)
                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
Creates a new queue with the given name (Optional Operation). It uses the given properties to configure the queue.

Parameters:
queueName - The queue's name
queueProperties - the queue's properties
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - If the operation is not supported.
